metadata.Title: CVE-2010-3393 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
magics-config in Magics++ 2.10.0 places a zero-length directory name in the LD_LIBRARY_PATH, which allows local users to gain privileges via a Trojan horse shared library in the current working directory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-3393` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmagics++-data - 2.18.15-5
libmagplus3v5 - 2.18.15-5
magics++ - 2.18.15-5
python-magics++ - 2.18.15-5
python3-magics++ - 2.18.15-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: magics++ package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.18.15-5').
